00028 /*
00029  * This file is part of Lustre, http://www.lustre.org/
00030  * Lustre is a trademark of Sun Microsystems, Inc.
00031  *
00032  * lustre/ofd/ofd_dev.c
00033  *
00034  * This file contains OSD API methods for OBD Filter Device (OFD),
00035  * request handlers and supplemental functions to set OFD up and clean it up.
00036  *
00037  * Author: Alex Zhuravlev <alexey.zhuravlev@intel.com>
00038  * Author: Mike Pershin <mike.pershin@intel.com>
00039  * Author: Johann Lombardi <johann.lombardi@intel.com>
00040  */
00041 /*
00042  * The OBD Filter Device (OFD) module belongs to the Object Storage
00043  * Server stack and connects the RPC oriented Unified Target (TGT)
00044  * layer (see lustre/include/lu_target.h) to the storage oriented OSD
00045  * layer (see Documentation/osd-api.txt).
00046  *
00047  *     TGT
00048  *      |      DT and OBD APIs
00049  *     OFD
00050  *      |      DT API
00051  *     OSD
00052  *
00053  * OFD implements the LU and OBD device APIs and is responsible for:
00054  *
00055  * - Handling client requests (create, destroy, bulk IO, setattr,
00056  *   get_info, set_info, statfs) for the objects belonging to the OST
00057  *   (together with TGT).
00058  *
00059  * - Providing grant space management which allows clients to reserve
00060  *   disk space for data writeback. OFD tracks grants on global and
00061  *   per client levels.
00062  *
00063  * - Handling object precreation requests from MDTs.
00064  *
00065  * - Operating the LDLM service that allows clients to maintain object
00066  *   data cache coherence.
00067  */
00068 
00069 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_FILTER

00083 static struct kmem_cache *ofd_object_kmem;

00085 static struct lu_kmem_descr ofd_caches[] = {
00086         {
00087                 .ckd_cache = &ofd_object_kmem,
00088                 .ckd_name  = "ofd_obj",
00089                 .ckd_size  = sizeof(struct ofd_object)
00090         },
00091         {
00092                 .ckd_cache = NULL
00093         }
00094 };

00110 static int ofd_connect_to_next(const struct lu_env *env, struct ofd_device *m,
00111                                const char *next, struct obd_export **exp)
00112 {
00113         struct obd_connect_data *data = NULL;
00114         struct obd_device       *obd;
00115         int                      rc;
00116         ENTRY;
00117 
00118         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(data);
00119         if (data == NULL)
00120                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOMEM);
00121 
00122         obd = class_name2obd(next);
00123         if (obd == NULL) {
00124                 CERROR("%s: can't locate next device: %s\n",
00125                        ofd_name(m), next);
00126                 GOTO(out, rc = -ENOTCONN);
00127         }
00128 
00129         data->ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_VERSION;
00130         data->ocd_version = LUSTRE_VERSION_CODE;
00131 
00132         rc = obd_connect(NULL, exp, obd, &obd->obd_uuid, data, NULL);
00133         if (rc) {
00134                 CERROR("%s: cannot connect to next dev %s: rc = %d\n",
00135                        ofd_name(m), next, rc);
00136                 GOTO(out, rc);
00137         }
00138 
00139         m->ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site =
00140                 m->ofd_osd_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev->ld_site;
00141         LASSERT(m->ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site);
00142         m->ofd_osd = lu2dt_dev(m->ofd_osd_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev);
00143         m->ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev.ld_site->ls_top_dev = &m->ofd_dt_dev.dd_lu_dev;
00144 
00145 out:
00146         if (data)
00147                 OBD_FREE_PTR(data);
00148         RETURN(rc);
00149 }
00150 
00163 static int ofd_stack_init(const struct lu_env *env,
00164                           struct ofd_device *m, struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00165 {
00166         const char              *dev = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0);
00167         struct lu_device        *d;
00168         struct ofd_thread_info  *info = ofd_info(env);
00169         struct lustre_mount_info *lmi;
00170         struct lustre_mount_data *lmd;
00171         int                      rc;
00172         char                    *osdname;
00173 
00174         ENTRY;
00175 
00176         lmi = server_get_mount(dev);
00177         if (lmi == NULL) {
00178                 CERROR("Cannot get mount info for %s!\n", dev);
00179                 RETURN(-ENODEV);
00180         }
00181 
00182         lmd = s2lsi(lmi->lmi_sb)->lsi_lmd;
00183         if (lmd != NULL && lmd->lmd_flags & LMD_FLG_SKIP_LFSCK)
00184                 m->ofd_skip_lfsck = 1;
00185 
00186         /* find bottom osd */
00187         OBD_ALLOC(osdname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00188         if (osdname == NULL)
00189                 RETURN(-ENOMEM);
00190 
00191         snprintf(osdname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN, "%s-osd", dev);
00192         rc = ofd_connect_to_next(env, m, osdname, &m->ofd_osd_exp);
00193         OBD_FREE(osdname, MTI_NAME_MAXLEN);
00194         if (rc)
00195                 RETURN(rc);
00196 
00197         d = m->ofd_osd_exp->exp_obd->obd_lu_dev;
00198         LASSERT(d);
00199         m->ofd_osd = lu2dt_dev(d);
00200 
00201         snprintf(info->fti_u.name, sizeof(info->fti_u.name),
00202                  "%s-osd", lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 0));
00203 
00204         RETURN(rc);
00205 }
00206 
00220 static void ofd_stack_fini(const struct lu_env *env, struct ofd_device *m,
00221                            struct lu_device *top)
00222 {
00223         struct obd_device       *obd = ofd_obd(m);
00224         struct lustre_cfg_bufs   bufs;
00225         struct lustre_cfg       *lcfg;
00226         char                     flags[3] = "";
00227 
00228         ENTRY;
00229 
00230         lu_site_purge(env, top->ld_site, ~0);
00231         /* process cleanup, pass mdt obd name to get obd umount flags */
00232         lustre_cfg_bufs_reset(&bufs, obd->obd_name);
00233         if (obd->obd_force)
00234                 strcat(flags, "F");
00235         if (obd->obd_fail)
00236                 strcat(flags, "A");
00237         lustre_cfg_bufs_set_string(&bufs, 1, flags);
00238         lcfg = lustre_cfg_new(LCFG_CLEANUP, &bufs);
00239         if (lcfg == NULL)
00240                 RETURN_EXIT;
00241 
00242         LASSERT(top);
00243         top->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, top, lcfg);
00244         lustre_cfg_free(lcfg);
00245 
00246         lu_site_purge(env, top->ld_site, ~0);
00247         if (!cfs_hash_is_empty(top->ld_site->ls_obj_hash)) {
00248                 LIBCFS_DEBUG_MSG_DATA_DECL(msgdata, D_ERROR, NULL);
00249                 lu_site_print(env, top->ld_site, &msgdata, lu_cdebug_printer);
00250         }
00251 
00252         LASSERT(m->ofd_osd_exp);
00253         obd_disconnect(m->ofd_osd_exp);
00254 
00255         EXIT;
00256 }

00258 /* For interoperability, see mdt_interop_param[]. */
00259 static struct cfg_interop_param ofd_interop_param[] = {
00260         { "ost.quota_type",     NULL },
00261         { NULL }
00262 };

00283 static bool match_symlink_param(char *param)
00284 {
00285         char *sval;
00286         int paramlen;
00287 
00288         if (class_match_param(param, PARAM_OST, &param) == 0) {
00289                 sval = strchr(param, '=');
00290                 if (sval != NULL) {
00291                         paramlen = sval - param;
00292                         if (strncmp(param, "writethrough_cache_enable",
00293                                     paramlen) == 0 ||
00294                             strncmp(param, "readcache_max_filesize",
00295                                     paramlen) == 0 ||
00296                             strncmp(param, "read_cache_enable",
00297                                     paramlen) == 0 ||
00298                             strncmp(param, "brw_stats", paramlen) == 0)
00299                                 return true;
00300                 }
00301         }
00302 
00303         return false;
00304 }
00305 
00319 static int ofd_process_config(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *d,
00320                               struct lustre_cfg *cfg)
00321 {
00322         struct ofd_device       *m = ofd_dev(d);
00323         struct dt_device        *dt_next = m->ofd_osd;
00324         struct lu_device        *next = &dt_next->dd_lu_dev;
00325         int                      rc;
00326 
00327         ENTRY;
00328 
00329         switch (cfg->lcfg_command) {
00330         case LCFG_PARAM: {
00331                 struct obd_device       *obd = ofd_obd(m);
00332                 /* For interoperability */
00333                 struct cfg_interop_param   *ptr = NULL;
00334                 struct lustre_cfg          *old_cfg = NULL;
00335                 char                       *param = NULL;
00336 
00337                 param = lustre_cfg_string(cfg, 1);
00338                 if (param == NULL) {
00339                         CERROR("param is empty\n");
00340                         rc = -EINVAL;
00341                         break;
00342                 }
00343 
00344                 ptr = class_find_old_param(param, ofd_interop_param);
00345                 if (ptr != NULL) {
00346                         if (ptr->new_param == NULL) {
00347                                 rc = 0;
00348                                 CWARN("For interoperability, skip this %s."
00349                                       " It is obsolete.\n", ptr->old_param);
00350                                 break;
00351                         }
00352 
00353                         CWARN("Found old param %s, changed it to %s.\n",
00354                               ptr->old_param, ptr->new_param);
00355 
00356                         old_cfg = cfg;
00357                         cfg = lustre_cfg_rename(old_cfg, ptr->new_param);
00358                         if (IS_ERR(cfg)) {
00359                                 rc = PTR_ERR(cfg);
00360                                 break;
00361                         }
00362                 }
00363 
00364                 if (match_symlink_param(param)) {
00365                         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
00366                         break;
00367                 }
00368 
00369                 rc = class_process_proc_param(PARAM_OST, obd->obd_vars, cfg,
00370                                               d->ld_obd);
00371                 if (rc > 0 || rc == -ENOSYS) {
00372                         CDEBUG(D_CONFIG, "pass param %s down the stack.\n",
00373                                param);
00374                         /* we don't understand; pass it on */
00375                         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
00376                 }
00377                 break;
00378         }
00379         case LCFG_SPTLRPC_CONF: {
00380                 rc = -ENOTSUPP;
00381                 break;
00382         }
00383         default:
00384                 /* others are passed further */
00385                 rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_process_config(env, next, cfg);
00386                 break;
00387         }
00388         RETURN(rc);
00389 }
00390 
00403 static int ofd_object_init(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o,
00404                            const struct lu_object_conf *conf)
00405 {
00406         struct ofd_device       *d = ofd_dev(o->lo_dev);
00407         struct lu_device        *under;
00408         struct lu_object        *below;
00409         int                      rc = 0;
00410 
00411         ENTRY;
00412 
00413         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "object init, fid = "DFID"\n",
00414                PFID(lu_object_fid(o)));
00415 
00416         under = &d->ofd_osd->dd_lu_dev;
00417         below = under->ld_ops->ldo_object_alloc(env, o->lo_header, under);
00418         if (below != NULL)
00419                 lu_object_add(o, below);
00420         else
00421                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00422 
00423         RETURN(rc);
00424 }
00425 
00434 static void ofd_object_free(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_object *o)
00435 {
00436         struct ofd_object       *of = ofd_obj(o);
00437         struct lu_object_header *h;
00438 
00439         ENTRY;
00440 
00441         h = o->lo_header;
00442         CDEBUG(D_INFO, "object free, fid = "DFID"\n",
00443                PFID(lu_object_fid(o)));
00444 
00445         lu_object_fini(o);
00446         lu_object_header_fini(h);
00447         OBD_SLAB_FREE_PTR(of, ofd_object_kmem);
00448         EXIT;
00449 }

00466                             lu_printer_t p, const struct lu_object *o)
00467 {
00468         return (*p)(env, cookie, LUSTRE_OST_NAME"-object@%p", o);
00469 }

00490 static struct lu_object *ofd_object_alloc(const struct lu_env *env,
00491                                           const struct lu_object_header *hdr,
00492                                           struct lu_device *d)
00493 {
00494         struct ofd_object *of;
00495 
00496         ENTRY;
00497 
00498         OBD_SLAB_ALLOC_PTR_GFP(of, ofd_object_kmem, GFP_NOFS);
00499         if (of != NULL) {
00500                 struct lu_object        *o;
00501                 struct lu_object_header *h;
00502 
00503                 o = &of->ofo_obj.do_lu;
00504                 h = &of->ofo_header;
00505                 lu_object_header_init(h);
00506                 lu_object_init(o, h, d);
00507                 lu_object_add_top(h, o);
00508                 o->lo_ops = &ofd_obj_ops;
00509                 RETURN(o);
00510         } else {
00511                 RETURN(NULL);
00512         }
00513 }
00514 
00528 static int ofd_lfsck_out_notify(const struct lu_env *env, void *data,
00529                                 enum lfsck_events event)
00530 {
00531         struct ofd_device *ofd = data;
00532         struct obd_device *obd = ofd_obd(ofd);
00533 
00534         switch (event) {
00535         case LE_LASTID_REBUILDING:
00536                 CWARN("%s: Found crashed LAST_ID, deny creating new OST-object "
00537                       "on the device until the LAST_ID rebuilt successfully.\n",
00538                       obd->obd_name);
00539                 down_write(&ofd->ofd_lastid_rwsem);
00540                 ofd->ofd_lastid_rebuilding = 1;
00541                 up_write(&ofd->ofd_lastid_rwsem);
00542                 break;
00543         case LE_LASTID_REBUILT: {
00544                 down_write(&ofd->ofd_lastid_rwsem);
00545                 ofd_seqs_free(env, ofd);
00546                 ofd->ofd_lastid_rebuilding = 0;
00547                 ofd->ofd_lastid_gen++;
00548                 up_write(&ofd->ofd_lastid_rwsem);
00549                 CWARN("%s: Rebuilt crashed LAST_ID files successfully.\n",
00550                       obd->obd_name);
00551                 break;
00552         }
00553         default:
00554                 CERROR("%s: unknown lfsck event: rc = %d\n",
00555                        ofd_name(ofd), event);
00556                 return -EINVAL;
00557         }
00558 
00559         return 0;
00560 }
00561 
00576 static int ofd_prepare(const struct lu_env *env, struct lu_device *pdev,
00577                        struct lu_device *dev)
00578 {
00579         struct ofd_thread_info          *info;
00580         struct ofd_device               *ofd = ofd_dev(dev);
00581         struct obd_device               *obd = ofd_obd(ofd);
00582         struct lu_device                *next = &ofd->ofd_osd->dd_lu_dev;
00583         int                              rc;
00584 
00585         ENTRY;
00586 
00587         info = ofd_info_init(env, NULL);
00588         if (info == NULL)
00589                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00590 
00591         /* initialize lower device */
00592         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_prepare(env, dev, next);
00593         if (rc != 0)
00594                 RETURN(rc);
00595 
00596         rc = lfsck_register(env, ofd->ofd_osd, ofd->ofd_osd, obd,
00597                             ofd_lfsck_out_notify, ofd, false);
00598         if (rc != 0) {
00599                 CERROR("%s: failed to initialize lfsck: rc = %d\n",
00600                        obd->obd_name, rc);
00601                 RETURN(rc);
00602         }
00603 
00604         rc = lfsck_register_namespace(env, ofd->ofd_osd, ofd->ofd_namespace);
00605         /* The LFSCK instance is registered just now, so it must be there when
00606          * register the namespace to such instance. */
00607         LASSERTF(rc == 0, "register namespace failed: rc = %d\n", rc);
00608 
00609         target_recovery_init(&ofd->ofd_lut, tgt_request_handle);
00610         LASSERT(obd->obd_no_conn);
00611         spin_lock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00612         obd->obd_no_conn = 0;
00613         spin_unlock(&obd->obd_dev_lock);
00614 
00615         if (obd->obd_recovering == 0)
00616                 ofd_postrecov(env, ofd);
00617 
00618         RETURN(rc);
00619 }
00620 
00634 static int ofd_recovery_complete(const struct lu_env *env,
00635                                  struct lu_device *dev)
00636 {
00637         struct ofd_thread_info  *oti = ofd_info(env);
00638         struct ofd_device       *ofd = ofd_dev(dev);
00639         struct lu_device        *next = &ofd->ofd_osd->dd_lu_dev;
00640         int                      rc = 0;
00641 
00642         ENTRY;
00643 
00644         /*
00645          * Grant space for object precreation on the self export.
00646          * The initial reserved space (i.e. 10MB for zfs and 280KB for ldiskfs)
00647          * is enough to create 10k objects. More space is then acquired for
00648          * precreation in ofd_grant_create().
00649          */
00650         memset(&oti->fti_ocd, 0, sizeof(oti->fti_ocd));
00651         oti->fti_ocd.ocd_grant = OST_MAX_PRECREATE / 2;
00652         oti->fti_ocd.ocd_grant *= ofd->ofd_dt_conf.ddp_inodespace;
00653         oti->fti_ocd.ocd_connect_flags = OBD_CONNECT_GRANT |
00654                                          OBD_CONNECT_GRANT_PARAM;
00655         ofd_grant_connect(env, dev->ld_obd->obd_self_export, &oti->fti_ocd,
00656                           true);
00657         rc = next->ld_ops->ldo_recovery_complete(env, next);
00658         RETURN(rc);
00659 }

00664 static struct lu_device_operations ofd_lu_ops = {
00665         .ldo_object_alloc       = ofd_object_alloc,
00666         .ldo_process_config     = ofd_process_config,
00667         .ldo_recovery_complete  = ofd_recovery_complete,
00668         .ldo_prepare            = ofd_prepare,
00669 };
